oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Push Button One - 1955-02-03 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM program Push Button One, originally broadcast February 3, 1955 at 4:30 pm, part 1. Featuring announcer and DJ Dave Overton playing recorded music with news reports by Bill Williams. Dave Overton discusses topics including The Nashville Record becoming middle Tennessee's fastest growing newspaper; the Miss Nashville High contest; the filming of the Grand Old Opry at Vanderbilt Theater, February 4 at 12:30 pm; and a plug for The Waking Crew program.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Dorothy Collins; Henri René; Jo Stafford; Perry Como
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: WSM jingle -- Opening statement (Dave Overton) -- Tweedlee Dee (Dorothy Collins) (recording) -- Dave Overton talks -- Paris Loves Lovers (Henri René) (recording) -- Dave Overton talks -- Suddenly (Jo Stafford) (recording) -- Dave Overton introduces Bill Williams -- News report (Bill Williams) -- Dave Overton talks -- Ko Ko Mo (I Love You So) (Perry Como) (recording) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Push button one (Radio program); Overton, Dave; Williams, Bill (Newsreader)
